body_html:
@fifothekid @mrry
I noticed that you built tensorflow with MKL, there is a known issue that comes with the previously installed tensorflow package in the system.

In detail, if your system has an installed tensorflow package, the cmake script will firstly import system module, rather than your compiled one. This will cause version mismatch and some import error occurs.

There is also another issue while importing google.protobuf, and I'm working it out. I suggest you at first uninstall any tensorflow packages (tensorflow-gpu, protobuf, grpcio) and build from scratch.

P.S For now, it will failed at importing google.protobuf, to work around, you must install and only install protobuf in the system.

UPDATE absl-py is required before building in cmake

There is also another issue while importing google.protobuf, and I'm working it out. I suggest you at first uninstall any tensorflow packages (tensorflow-gpu, protobuf, grpcio) and build from scratch.
P.S For now, it will failed at importing google.protobuf, to work around, you must install and only install protobuf in the system.

body:
@fifothekid @mrry 
I noticed that you built tensorflow with **MKL**, there is a known issue that comes with the previously installed tensorflow package in the system.

In detail, if your system has an installed tensorflow package, the cmake script will firstly import system module, rather than your compiled one. This will cause version mismatch and some import error occurs.

There is also another issue while importing `google.protobuf`, and I'm working it out. I suggest you at first uninstall any tensorflow packages (`tensorflow-gpu`, `protobuf`, `grpcio`) and build from scratch.

**P.S** For now, it will failed at importing google.protobuf, to work around, you must install and only install `protobuf` in the system.

**UPDATE** `absl-py` is required before building in cmake
